Concomitant products included AMLODIPINE, MORPHINE SULFATE, AMITRIPTYLINE, METFORMIN, GABAPENTIN, LOSARTAN, CLOPIDOGREL, PANTOPRAZOLE, RISPERIDONE, DAILYVIT WOMEN 50+, INSULIN HUMAN INJECTION, ISOPHANE (NOVOLIN N) and INSULIN ASPART for an unknown indication. On 21-Feb-2021, the patient experienced CEREBROVASCULAR ACCIDENT (possibility of having a stroke) (seriousness criterion hospitalization), NEUROLOGICAL SYMPTOM (severe neurological symptoms) (seriousness criterion hospitalization), SPEECH DISORDER (difficulty with her speech (can think of the word, but could not get it out)) (seriousness criterion hospitalization) and GAIT DISTURBANCE (she had gait problems) (seriousness criterion hospitalization). On an unknown date, the patient experienced PRODUCT DOSE OMISSION ISSUE (Missed dose ). The patient was hospitalized on 21-Feb-2021 due to CEREBROVASCULAR ACCIDENT, GAIT DISTURBANCE, NEUROLOGICAL SYMPTOM and SPEECH DISORDER. On 10-Mar-2021, CEREBROVASCULAR ACCIDENT (possibility of having a stroke), NEUROLOGICAL SYMPTOM (severe neurological symptoms), SPEECH DISORDER (difficulty with her speech (can think of the word, but could not get it out)) and GAIT DISTURBANCE (she had gait problems) had resolved. At the time of the report, PRODUCT DOSE OMISSION ISSUE (Missed dose ) had resolved. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) was unknown. Treatment information was not provided. 75 2021-04-30 acute respiratory failure CT scan 04 Mar 2021 showed bronchiectasis in lower lobes more pronounced; interstitial lung disease ... Read more
Close
CT scan 04 Mar 2021 showed bronchiectasis in lower lobes more pronounced; interstitial lung disease with progressive fibrotic phenotype in diseases classified elsewhere; acute respiratory failure with hypoxia/dyspnea on exertion; possibility of an acute inflammatory response to her COVID-19 vaccination; restrictive lung disease; CT scan 04 Mar 2021 showed bronchiectasis in lower lobes more pronounced; pulmonary fibrosis; diffuse cramping/leg cramps; This spontaneous case was reported by a physician and describes the occurrence of PULMONARY FIBROSIS (pulmonary fibrosis), INTERSTITIAL LUNG DISEASE (interstitial lung disease with progressive fibrotic phenotype in diseases classified elsewhere), BRONCHIECTASIS (CT scan 04 Mar 2021 showed bronchiectasis in lower lobes more pronounced), ACUTE RESPIRATORY FAILURE (acute respiratory failure with hypoxia/dyspnea on exertion), INFLAMMATION (possibility of an acute inflammatory response to her COVID-19 vaccination), RESTRICTIVE PULMONARY DISEASE (restrictive lung disease) and CONDITION AGGRAVATED (CT scan 04 Mar 2021 showed bronchiectasis in lower lobes more pronounced) in a 75-year-old female patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. 011L20A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. The patient's past medical history included Smoker (at least 45 pack years) in January 2020, Anemia, Spinal operation (thoracic upper lumbar spine) and Cholecystectomy. Concurrent medical conditions included Penicillin allergy, Pulmonary fibrosis since 2016, Hypertension, GERD (without esophagitis), Chronic kidney disease stage 3 (stage 3b), Interstitial pneumonitis (idiopathic), Centrilobular emphysema, Bronchiectasis and Pancreatic atrophy (fatty atrophy on CT scan chest 04 Mar 2021). Concomitant products included FAMOTIDINE (PEPCID [FAMOTIDINE]) and PANTOPRAZOLE SODIUM SESQUIHYDRATE (PROTONIX [PANTOPRAZOLE SODIUM SESQUIHYDRATE]) for GERD, CALCIUM CARBONATE, MAGNESIUM CARBONATE (TUMS [CALCIUM CARBONATE;MAGNESIUM CARBONATE]), CALCIUM, VITAMIN D3, CYCLOBENZAPRINE HYDROCHLORIDE (FLEXERIL [CYCLOBENZAPRINE HYDROCHLORIDE]), FUROSEMIDE (LASIX [FUROSEMIDE]), SULFAMETHOXAZOLE, TRIMETHOPRIM (BACTRIM DS) and TRAMADOL HYDROCHLORIDE (ULTRAM [TRAMADOL HYDROCHLORIDE]) for an unknown indication. On 20-Jan-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 17-Feb-2021, received second dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) dosage was changed to 1 dosage form. On 27-Jan-2021, the patient experienced PULMONARY FIBROSIS (pulmonary fibrosis) (seriousness criteria hospitalization, disability and life threatening), RESTRICTIVE PULMONARY DISEASE (restrictive lung disease) (seriousness criteria hospitalization, disability and life threatening) and CONDITION AGGRAVATED (CT scan 04 Mar 2021 showed bronchiectasis in lower lobes more pronounced) (seriousness criteria hospitalization, disability and life threatening). In February 2021, the patient experienced ACUTE RESPIRATORY FAILURE (acute respiratory failure with hypoxia/dyspnea on exertion) (seriousness criteria hospitalization, disability and life threatening) and INFLAMMATION (possibility of an acute inflammatory response to her COVID-19 vaccination) (seriousness criteria hospitalization, disability and life threatening). On 18-Feb-2021, after starting mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine), the patient experienced MUSCLE SPASMS (diffuse cramping/leg cramps). On 24-Feb-2021, the patient experienced INTERSTITIAL LUNG DISEASE (interstitial lung disease with progressive fibrotic phenotype in diseases classified elsewhere) (seriousness criteria hospitalization, disability and life threatening). On 04-Mar-2021, the patient experienced BRONCHIECTASIS (CT scan 04 Mar 2021 showed bronchiectasis in lower lobes more pronounced) (seriousness criteria hospitalization, disability and life threatening). The patient was hospitalized from 31-Mar-2021 to 06-Apr-2021 due to ACUTE RESPIRATORY FAILURE, BRONCHIECTASIS, CONDITION AGGRAVATED, INFLAMMATION, INTERSTITIAL LUNG DISEASE, PULMONARY FIBROSIS and RESTRICTIVE PULMONARY DISEASE. At the time of the report, PULMONARY FIBROSIS (pulmonary fibrosis), INTERSTITIAL LUNG DISEASE (interstitial lung disease with progressive fibrotic phenotype in diseases classified elsewhere), BRONCHIECTASIS (CT scan 04 Mar 2021 showed bronchiectasis in lower lobes more pronounced), ACUTE RESPIRATORY FAILURE (acute respiratory failure with hypoxia/dyspnea on exertion), INFLAMMATION (possibility of an acute inflammatory response to her COVID-19 vaccination), RESTRICTIVE PULMONARY DISEASE (restrictive lung disease) and CONDITION AGGRAVATED (CT scan 04 Mar 2021 showed bronchiectasis in lower lobes more pronounced) had not resolved and MUSCLE SPASMS (diffuse cramping/leg cramps) outcome was unknown. DIAGNOSTIC RESULTS (normal ranges are provided in parenthesis if available): On 27-Jan-2021, Computerised tomogram: no sign change (Inconclusive) stable findings of pulmonary fibrosis/chronic interstitial lung disease. On 27-Jan-2021, Oxygen saturation: 99 % (normal) 99 room air. On 27-Jan-2021, Pulmonary function test: abnormal (abnormal) moderate reduction in diffusion capacity; forced vital, total lung, and diffusion capacities diminished. On 03-Mar-2021, Oxygen saturation: 95 % (normal) room air. On 04-Mar-2021, Computerised tomogram: abnormal (abnormal) no PE, dramatic worsening of diffuse infiltrates much c/w UIP pattern; bronchiectasis in lower lobes more pronounced. On 05-Mar-2021, Oxygen saturation: 80 % (abnormal) 94 at rest, 80 when ambulating, then 96 when ambulating with O2. On 08-Mar-2021, Echocardiogram: abnormal (abnormal) EF 60-65%, RVSP moderately elevated- 45 mmHg, mild MV regurgitation. On 21-Mar-2021, Chest X-ray: abnormal (abnormal) low lung volumes with reticular opacities both lungs-uncertain if acute pneumonia or chronic fibrotic chnage. On 22-Mar-2021, Computerised tomogram: abnormal (abnormal) increased small pleural effusion and evidence of ischemic cardiomyopathy; overall fibrosis increased. On 23-Mar-2021, Bronchoscopy: abnormal (abnormal) neutrophilic lavage with negative cultures. On 09-Apr-2021, Oxygen saturation: 78 % (Low) 78% Room air 88% on 4L/min O2; 91% on 8L/min. On 14-Apr-2021, Chest X-ray: abnormal (abnormal) diffuse interstitial infiltrates, no pleural effusion. For mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular), the reporter considered INFLAMMATION (possibility of an acute inflammatory response to her COVID-19 vaccination) to be possibly related. No further causality assessments were provided for PULMONARY FIBROSIS (pulmonary fibrosis), INTERSTITIAL LUNG DISEASE (interstitial lung disease with progressive fibrotic phenotype in diseases classified elsewhere), BRONCHIECTASIS (CT scan 04 Mar 2021 showed bronchiectasis in lower lobes more pronounced), ACUTE RESPIRATORY FAILURE (acute respiratory failure with hypoxia/dyspnea on exertion), RESTRICTIVE PULMONARY DISEASE (restrictive lung disease), CONDITION AGGRAVATED (CT scan 04 Mar 2021 showed bronchiectasis in lower lobes more pronounced) and MUSCLE SPASMS (diffuse cramping/leg cramps). Patient was seen by physician (MD) (the reporter, a pulmonary specialist) on 27 Jan 2021 with complaint of short of breath with heavy exertion; was chronically breathless going up stairs. Her pulmonary physiology had been relatively stable over last couple of years. Impression: Appeared to have worsening restrictive physiology (also reported as slight worsening) in the setting of stable pulmonary fibrosis on imaging. Then, on 04 Mar 2021, the patient presented with worsened breathlessness of rather acute onset, starting approximately 24 Feb 2021. Repeat CT scan showed no pulmonary embolism but showed dramatic worsening of her pulmonary parenchyma and then findings suggesting exacerbation of underlying IPF like picture. The was also a significant change in spirometry. She was placed on large dose prednisone with transient stabilization but then presented to the emergency room on 21 Mar 2021 very breathless. No obvious infectious like picture. She was treated with high-dose corticosteroids. One more CT scan showed continued abnormalities with again increased ground-glass opacification. She showed desaturation with limited activity. The patient was hospitalized for 7 days, then discharged to inpatient rehab for 10 days on prednisone 60 mg. She improved slightly and was discharged home on 6L of O2 with exertion and 4L at rest. On 14 Apr 2021, the patient saw MD for follow-up at which time she was breathless with any significant activities and had difficulty getting around. She was approved for nintedanib therapy for progressive pulmonary fibrosis. Assessment included acute on chronic respiratory failure with hypoxia.; Sender's Comments: Very limited information regarding these events has been provided at this time. The events are probably related to the patient's comorbidities.

Close
Redness at the area of the injection, the size of an egg; COVID arm; Dizzy spell; Fall; Brain bleed; Intermittent episodes of high blood pressure; Intermittent episodes of rapid heartbeat; Difficulty sleeping; Headaches; soreness at the site of the injection; Flushing in her face; Humming in the ears; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer (subsequently medically confirmed) and describes the occurrence of CEREBRAL HAEMORRHAGE (Brain bleed) in a 75-year-old female patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. 032L20A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. No Medical History information was reported. On 25-Jan-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 25-Jan-2021, the patient experienced FLUSHING (Flushing in her face). 25-Jan-2021, the patient experienced VACCINATION SITE PAIN (soreness at the site of the injection). On 27-Jan-2021, the patient experienced BLOOD PRESSURE FLUCTUATION (Intermittent episodes of high blood pressure), HEART RATE INCREASED (Intermittent episodes of rapid heartbeat), INSOMNIA (Difficulty sleeping) and HEADACHE (Headaches). On 29-Jan-2021, the patient experienced CEREBRAL HAEMORRHAGE (Brain bleed) (seriousness criterion medically significant), DIZZINESS (Dizzy spell) and FALL (Fall). On 02-Feb-2021, the patient experienced TYPE IV HYPERSENSITIVITY REACTION (COVID arm). On 04-Feb-2021, the patient experienced VACCINATION SITE ERYTHEMA (Redness at the area of the injection, the size of an egg). On an unknown date, the patient experienced TINNITUS (Humming in the ears). On 25-Jan-2021, FLUSHING (Flushing in her face) and VACCINATION SITE PAIN (soreness at the site of the injection) had resolved. On 10-Feb-2021, TYPE IV HYPERSENSITIVITY REACTION (COVID arm) had resolved. At the time of the report, CEREBRAL HAEMORRHAGE (Brain bleed), DIZZINESS (Dizzy spell), FALL (Fall) and VACCINATION SITE ERYTHEMA (Redness at the area of the injection, the size of an egg) outcome was unknown and BLOOD PRESSURE FLUCTUATION (Intermittent episodes of high blood pressure), HEART RATE INCREASED (Intermittent episodes of rapid heartbeat), TINNITUS (Humming in the ears), INSOMNIA (Difficulty sleeping) and HEADACHE (Headaches) had resolved. DIAGNOSTIC RESULTS (normal ranges are provided in parenthesis if available): On 01-Feb-2021, Electrocardiogram: normal (normal) Normal. On 01-Feb-2021, Magnetic resonance imaging: normal (normal) Normal. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) was unknown. Concomitant product use was not reported. Treatment included steroids. Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. Most recent FOLLOW-UP information incorporated above includes: On 21-Apr-2021: New events of blood pressure fluctuation, heart rate increased, headache, Covid arm, tinnitus, dizziness, fall, insomnia, and cerebral haemorrhage (serious) added; case upgraded to serious; Labs coded; treatment information added.; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

Patient went to bed that night and husband noted she was sleeping comfortbly with no breathing difficulties at midnight. At 3 am husband found patient cold and she had expired.

75 2021-05-03 blood clot The blood vessels to the pt's spleen burst due to a clot causing removal of her spleen. During surge... Read more
Close
The blood vessels to the pt's spleen burst due to a clot causing removal of her spleen. During surgery she was given 2 units of blood. Due to blood clots (albeit in other parts of the body) with other vaccines, the lack of splenic trauma preceeding this event, the pt's lack of history re: blood clots, and in the interest of furthering this emerging COVID-19 vaccine technology/progress, the pt's PCP and this POA thought it worth noting.

75 2021-05-18 pneumonia The patient developed quick onset of generalized weakness and nonproductive cough. She was admitted... Read more
Close
The patient developed quick onset of generalized weakness and nonproductive cough. She was admitted to the critical care unit from the Emergency Department and was positive for COVID-19, right upper lobe pneumonia, septic shock, and COPD exacerbation. She received her most recent chemotherapy treatment for lymphoma about one week prior to admission. She received treatment for pneumonia with vancomycin and meropenem, remdesivir, dexamethasone, albuterol, and pressor support with norepinphrine. As of May 19th, she has improved significantly, but still remains in the critical care unit.

75 2021-05-24 systemic inflammatory response syndrome 3/4, admitted day after covid vaccine with SIRS. Patient presented to ED with fever/chills, weakness... Read more
Close
3/4, admitted day after covid vaccine with SIRS. Patient presented to ED with fever/chills, weakness, and malaise on the morning of presentation, such that her son who is her caretaker could not get her up off the toilet on several occasions. Patient had received the second of her Moderna Covid vaccinations the day prior and after workup in the ER and an observation stay, it is most likely that her presentation was a SIRS-type reaction to her vaccine. She does have a resolving left arm cellulitis that her PCP has been managing and documenting improvement with and she was kept on antibiotics this stay, consistent with her outpatient treatment plan. She'll discharge home and cont to see her PCP for her left arm and chronic issues.

75 2021-06-01 sepsis, fluid around the heart, acute respiratory failure Pt presented to acute care on 5/21/21 following 2 weeks of SOB, intermittent low grade fever and fat... Read more
Close
Pt presented to acute care on 5/21/21 following 2 weeks of SOB, intermittent low grade fever and fatigue. Labs and chest XR ordered. Diagnosed with UTI and placed on Omnicef 300 mg BID x 7 days. Follow up in clinic on 5/24/21 for continuation of symptoms: SOB, intermittent low grade fever/chills, dry cough. Pt prescribed albuterol and labs ordered. Follow up in clinic on 5/26/21 for ongoing SOB, intermittent low grade fever, dry cough, anemia, abnormal liver function. Ordered ECG 12 lead and sent to emergency department. Admitted to hospital 5/26/21 : During hospitalization patient was diuresed with Bumex, she put out a net of approximately 2.4 L and then developed an AKI suggestive of intravascular depletion. Diuretics were stopped, confirmed that BNP down trended and was within normal range. Patient had negative troponins throughout hospitalization. Her free T4 and TSH was within normal limits. She had mild electrolyte disturbances secondary to diuretics which were replaced. She had a respiratory viral panel completed, did not identify any source. Patient is Covid negative. ANA and ANCA screen were sent out unfortunately they will be delayed. #SVT: Patient went into an SVT rate of 150 required adenosine which showed underlying sinus rhythm. Started on amiodarone drip briefly which did help maintain sinus rhythm although she had hypotension with that. Cardiology was consulted during hospitalization. Despite SVT troponins remain negative. TSH and free T4 within normal limits. #Acute on chronic combined systolic and diastolic heart failure #Suspected viral cardiomyopathy #Acute respiratory failure with hypoxia Patient remains with good saturation off oxygen. She is net -2.0 L from diuresis. Weight is down approximately 4.4 kg. Started on metoprolol, unfortunately due to hypotension had to decrease the dose to 25 mg daily. Aspirin 81 mg daily was provided. Currently holding diuretics but may need to be reassessed for restarting this in the future. ANA and ANCA pending. #Leukocytosis #Increase inflammatory markers #Sepsis with organ dysfunction No clear-cut source of infection but she did have pyuria with leukocyte esterase. She could also have had atypical pneumonia. The concern is that patient could have an underlying inflammatory process versus autoimmune process contributing to it end organ damage. At this point I cannot tell so started empiric treatment with ceftriaxone during hospitalization, complete 5 of 7 days course as well as 3 of 3 days of azithromycin. Despite this leukocyte continues to be elevated and inflammatory markers continue to be elevated. #Hypertension: Patient was briefly hypotensive in setting of amiodarone, metoprolol continue to 25 mg after discontinuation of amiodarone. Will need to be retitrate to goal-directed therapy. #Hypothyroid: TSH and free T4 within normal limits given the tachycardia holding levothyroxine for 5 days #Suspected UTI Day 5 of 7 of ceftriaxone currently, initially had 50?100 WBCs positive for pyuria, leukocyte esterase positive no bacteria seen. #Atypical pneumonia suspected: Completed 3 days of azithromycin #Elevated LFTs #Elevated alk phos: Unclear as to potential source other than congestive hepatopathy LFTs normalized alk phos downtrending #Anemia of chronic disease: Possible viral syndrome unclear etiology at this point. There may be some underlying iron deficiency. No indication for transfusion during this hospitalization. Patient remained on sodium restricted 2 g daily, and 2 L of fluid restriction diet. She is a full code and enoxaparin was used for DVT prophylaxis. Hospital transfer today, 6/2/2021 to St. Michaels with no clear unifying diagnosis. Maybe a pericarditis: Patient continues to have ST changes on EKG, elevated inflammatory markers, significant JVD, evidence of heart failure on echocardiogram, after speaking with cardiology will likely need a right heart cath

Polyp 1.3 centimeter with blood clot beside polyp; Sudden gush of dark red blood - thick, like gel, more than water, last period (Menopause) 22 years ago; Since then, she had spotting every day; 22 days gap; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer (subsequently medically confirmed) and describes the occurrence of POSTMENOPAUSAL HAEMORRHAGE (Sudden gush of dark red blood - thick, like gel, more than water, last period (Menopause) 22 years ago) in a 75-year-old female patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch nos. 026A21A and 038K20A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. Concurrent medical conditions included Anemia iron deficiency (because she is vegan), Attention deficit disorder, Cold sores, Migraine (menstrual related), Hypertension (mild) and Drug allergy (sensitive to some medication, as per patient; might not be significant). Concomitant products included IRON for Anemia iron deficiency, DEXMETHYLPHENIDATE HYDROCHLORIDE (FOCALIN [DEXMETHYLPHENIDATE HYDROCHLORIDE]) for Attention deficit disorder, LOSARTAN for Blood pressure high, ACICLOVIR (ACYCLOVIR ALPHARMA [ACICLOVIR]) from an unknown date to 09-Feb-2021 for Cold sore (herpetic), TROPICAMIDE (MIDRIN M) for Migraine, ESTROGENS CONJUGATED (PREMARIN) for Vaginal dryness, COLECALCIFEROL (VITAMIN D3), FISH OIL from an unknown date to 09-Feb-2021 and PYRIDOXINE HYDROCHLORIDE (VITAMIN B6) from an unknown date to 09-Feb-2021 for an unknown indication. On 09-Feb-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 03-Mar-2021, received second dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (unknown route) dosage was changed to 1 dosage form. On 03-Mar-2021, the patient experienced INAPPROPRIATE SCHEDULE OF PRODUCT ADMINISTRATION (22 days gap). On 16-May-2021, the patient experienced POSTMENOPAUSAL HAEMORRHAGE (Sudden gush of dark red blood - thick, like gel, more than water, last period (Menopause) 22 years ago) (seriousness criterion medically significant) and VAGINAL HAEMORRHAGE (Since then, she had spotting every day). On 27-May-2021, the patient experienced POLYP (Polyp 1.3 centimeter with blood clot beside polyp). On 03-Mar-2021, INAPPROPRIATE SCHEDULE OF PRODUCT ADMINISTRATION (22 days gap) had resolved. At the time of the report, POSTMENOPAUSAL HAEMORRHAGE (Sudden gush of dark red blood - thick, like gel, more than water, last period (Menopause) 22 years ago) and POLYP (Polyp 1.3 centimeter with blood clot beside polyp) outcome was unknown and VAGINAL HAEMORRHAGE (Since then, she had spotting every day) had not resolved. DIAGNOSTIC RESULTS (normal ranges are provided in parenthesis if available): On 17-May-2021, Gynaecological examination: normal (normal) Normal. On 27-May-2021, Ultrasound scan: abnormal (abnormal) found to have a polyp measuring 1.3 centimeters and a little blood clot was beside the polyp. Treatment included hysteroscopy, dilatation and curettage to remove polyp and clot, and specimens were sent to pathology, results not provided. She will be having a post-operation follow up consultation on 8 Jun 2021 with her gynecologist. Based on current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the event, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.
